text.0:
Do you want to join the battle against misinformation in Africa and help us clarify facts?

:woman_technologist: We're looking for copy editors to join our team.

:globe_showing_Europe-Africa: Kenya, Uganda or Tanzania

:writing_hand_selector: Apply here by 7 December: https://t.co/0tWAd3cGu1

#IkoKaziKE #NafasiZaKazi
text.1:
:police_car_light: HOAX: A website advertising cash prizes for @mtnug customers is fake.

:warning_selector: The telecommunications company has warned its customers about the promotion: https://t.co/kEMZKn5uBs
text.2:
:police_car_light: HOAX: A Google form claiming to advertise job opportunities at supermarket chain Carrefour is fake.

:warning_selector: The retailer does not require job seekers to pay a registration fee and conducts recruitment with two accredited agencies: https://t.co/1Y0H64nm64
text.3:
:police_car_light: HOAX: A poster shared on Facebook claiming that Kenya's deputy president William Ruto is wanted for first-degree murder is fake.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The National Police Service has disowned the wanted poster: https://t.co/dz6qS5EVR4
